p: The meaning of the word environment has evolved over time. In the old literature, the word “environémenz” designates circle, circuit, or contour, then it expressed an action of surrounding “environment” ( Bontoux, 2011). Nowadays, the word environment has become a polysemy, meaning “action of surrounding” and it can make sense of context, of the neighborhood, notably in linguistics. The most recent definition considers the environment as the set of physical, chemical, or biological elements, natural and artificial, that surrounds a human being, an animal or a plant, or simply a species. This definition is often criticized by the fact that human occupies the epicenter and that all development policies are moving toward this goal.
